intro: Valeriana warburgii subsp. variabilis, commonly known as the variable valerian, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its rhizomes contain compounds that have been traditionally used in herbal medicine. The subspecies is notable for its variability in leaf shape and flowering time, which contributes to its classification as a distinct subspecies.
